| **Date** | **Sign** |
| Foreign Body Control Procedure | Is the Foreign body Control procedure easily available on the electronic and hard copy format? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Review the header - is it the latest revision, check that the dates and signatures are present on the hard copy Is it a controlled copy? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Natural work group trained | Have the personnel been trained on this procedure? Understood by all personnel? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Up to date records table | Is the Records table up to date? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Record compliance | Select a key Records input and verify compliance.  Correct revision in use?  If records are changed after initial recording/entry, are changes clearly legible (errors marked through and initialed); recorded in ink, not pencil? Free of “correction fluid”? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Glass, Brittle plastics, ceramics and similar materials control | Are glass and brittle plastics included in a risk assessment such as HACCP? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is there a glass and brittle plastics register which includes:   * List of items detailing Iocation, number, type and condition * Recorded checks of condition of items carried out at a specified frequency based on the level of risk to the product * Details of cleaning or replacing of items to minimize product |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is there a documented breakage incident procedure? Is there a person in charge of the clean up and preventing further contamination? Is contaminated product inspected, segregated or disposed of? Are incidents recorded? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Dedicated Colour coded cleaning equipment used for the removal of glass and breakages? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | There shall be no unnecessary non production glass or brittle plastic which may pose a risk of contamination. Necessary glass and brittle plastics are maintained in good condition and protected, where possible, against breakage. |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Sharps Control | Is there a documented policy for the control of sharps? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are sharp blades, equipment and tools controlled to prevent product contamination? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are snap off blade knives forbidden on the production floor? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| No loose fastenings, such as drawing pins and staples, are used on open notice boards in production and storage area? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Sharp blades, equipment and tools shall not be left in a position that allows them to contaminate the product. |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Sharp register available and up to date. Recon of blades on the shop floor accurate |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Tooling Rack in Production in order. No loose bolts and nuts and other foreign objects obvious? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Loose tools packed away? Nuts and Bolt not in use in designated containers? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Condition of Packing Table : Free of any damage and/or foreign object contamination |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Condition of Conveyor Belt : Free of any damage and/or foreign object contamination |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Machine Check as per Production Log Sheets for Equipment that if faulty may pose risk to product contamination - Back Gusset Punch - initialled and working correctly? No signs of debris or punch outs due to faulty equipment? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Temporary Modifications on all machinery: Intact and recorded on Production Log Sheet. No risk of foreign body contamination. |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | All Zipper Cartons used in production off floor? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Chemical and biological control | Is there a documented chemical control program? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is there an approved list of chemicals for purchase? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is Hazard and risk analysis used to identify, control and manage any potential risks from microbiological contamination and any potential allergen s? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are MSDS and specifications available for chemicals? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are all chemical containers labelled and identified at all times? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Access to chemical storage areas restricted to authorised personnel only? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Strongly scented products avoided? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Chemicals used by trained personnel only? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Confirmation of detergent suitability for use in food packaging processing environment available (SABS 1828 , SABS 1853) |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Water Pipes from Chiller units not leaking or posing risk to product - Chemical/Microbiological Control. Cooler Bars - emphasise on zipper plates |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
